reporting-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Netherlands

title.narrative: NDE Women in Panchayati Raj Institution

description.narrative: The project emphasis on women and men Community Correspondents (CCs) to start Community Health Action Teams (CHATs) in their villages to empower the community to strengthen local public health. During the pandemic the public health became utmost important. The key question is – has public health improved during COIVD times, is hospital services improved or are all Public Health centers getting revamped? These CHAT teams will use video storytelling to hold to account, to inspire, and to raise the visibility of different groups to achieve SDG3 SDG 16. The project objectives include following activities :where entire village will benefit as local institutions become more effective, and less beholden to special interest. • 20 community correspondents trained (one residential 3-day training) in monitoring public health systems and programs with a view to identifying problems and work with community leaders/elders to fix the gaps and solve malfunctioning or non-availability of health services. • 20 Community Health Action Teams functioning monthly around India, with at least 50% led by women. • At least 20 CHAT Whatsapp groups created and running, with local officials and activists in these groups, discussing community issues. • 300 community members mobilized, trained and equipped to take actions to resolve infrastructure and service delivery issues related to health. • 20 government health officials contacted and petitioned each month to workout solutions. • 20 success stories created to inspire other community correspondents to take up similar projects in their areas. The outcome will be that 20 CCs will deepen their leadership skills in the community. The 300+ Action Group Members will learn to make local institutions more effective, and the challenges in doing so. As long-term residents in those villages/districts, this will help them assert their rights. The entire village will benefit as local health institutions become more effective. Anecdotes, stories and learning of the program will be widely disseminated on VV’s social media platforms like FB, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube etc. Success stories will be particularly promoted.
